sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using matrix methods
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations using matrix methods:

$2x_1 + 3x_2 - 4x_3 = 7$

$-2x_1 + 6x_2 + 3x_3 = -23$

$7x_1 - 5x_2 + 2x_3 = 29$
message_2:
To solve the given system of linear equations using matrix methods, we first represent the system as an augmented matrix:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
2 & 3 & -4 & | & 7 \\
-2 & 6 & 3 & | & -23 \\
7 & -5 & 2 & | & 29
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Now, we will perform Gaussian elimination to get the matrix in row-echelon form:

1. Swap Row 1 and Row 3:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
7 & -5 & 2 & | & 29 \\
-2 & 6 & 3 & | & -23 \\
2 & 3 & -4 & | & 7
\end{bmatrix}
$$

2. Add (2/7) * Row 1 to Row 2 and (-2/7) * Row 1 to Row 3:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
7 & -5 & 2 & | & 29 \\
0 & 31/7 & 17/7 & | & -37/7 \\
0 & 11/7 & -30/7 & | & -15/7
\end{bmatrix}
$$

3. Multiply Row 2 by 7/31 and Row 3 by 7/11:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
7 & -5 & 2 & | & 29 \\
0 & 1 & 17/31 & | & -37/31 \\
0 & 1 & -30/11 & | & -15/11
\end{bmatrix}
$$

4. Add -1 * Row 2 to Row 3:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
7 & -5 & 2 & | & 29 \\
0 & 1 & 17/31 & | & -37/31 \\
0 & 0 & -697/341 & | & -142/341
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Now, we have the matrix in row-echelon form. We can use back-substitution to find the values of $x_1$, $x_2$, and $x_3$:

1. Divide Row 3 by -697/341:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
7 & -5 & 2 & | & 29 \\
0 & 1 & 17/31 & | & -37/31 \\
0 & 0 & 1 & | & 142/697
\end{bmatrix}
$$

2. Substitute $x_3$ into Row 2 and Row 1:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
7 & -5 & 0 & | & 29 - 2(142/697) \\
0 & 1 & 0 & | & -37/31 - 17/31(142/697) \\
0 & 0 & 1 & | & 142/697
\end{bmatrix}
$$

3. Substitute $x_2$ into Row 1:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
7 & 0 & 0 & | & 29 - 2(142/697) + 5[-37/31 - 17/31(142/697)] \\
0 & 1 & 0 & | & -37/31 - 17/31(142/697) \\
0 & 0 & 1 & | & 142/697
\end{bmatrix}
$$

4. Divide Row 1 by 7:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 0 & 0 & | & [29 - 2(142/697) + 5[-37/31 - 17/31(142/697)]]/7 \\
0 & 1 & 0 & | & -37/31 - 17/31(142/697) \\
0 & 0 & 1 & | & 142/697
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Now, we have the matrix in the reduced row-echelon form, and we can read off the solutions:

$$
x_1 = [29 - 2(142/697) + 5[-37/31 - 17/31(142/697)]]/7 \\
x_2 = -37/31 - 17/31(142/697) \\
x_3 = 142/697
$$

Simplifying the expressions, we get:

$$
x_1 = 3 \\
x_2 = -2 \\
x_3 = 142/697
$$
